title: HRIS Solution Team Leader- Spain and Portugal
content:
ROLE OVERVIEW
Established in 1981 with a single store in the Northwest of England, the JD Group is a leading omni-channel retailer of Sports Fashion, Outdoors and Gyms with over 60,000 colleagues and over 3,400 stores across several retail fascias in over 30 markets around the world. JD Sports Fashion Plc was listed on the London Stock Exchange in 1996 and has been a FTSE100 publicly quoted company since 2019 and continues to grow in the UK and internationally.
We want to be the leading global omnichannel retailer in the sports and outdoor industry. To be a part of this successful company and help us to achieve this you will have the desire to ingrain our strategic goals of being a people-led, innovative and customer-focused organisation which provides operational excellence whilst identifying new areas of growth as part of our day to day objectives.
Advance the People Teams impact by delivering a full HRIS programme within a cluster of European countries aimed at positioning JD as an employer of choice. The JD People team puts the colleague at the heart of what we do to develop a level of service that emulates the JD brand and maximises colleague experience. We are looking for an outstanding Solution Owner, with experience in designing and implementing complex, high profile HRIS implementations. The Solution Owner will be supported by a number of dedicated roles as part of this project and support the design of an HRIS solution across Europe. The role key objective will be to contribute to overarching global design principles, with essential changes for local territory requirements. This role is both strategic and hands-on, candidates must be capable of understanding business requirements and processes with the ability to configure system infrastructure to deliver requirements alongside the management of multinational teams and other key supporting roles. In addition to communicating with and managing stakeholders, the successful candidate will need to be process-driven, highly analytical and organised.
A successful SME should possess a good track record in evaluating organizational needs and configuration of solutions, improving organizational efficiency by applying their expert knowledge of one or more areas of the People function to resolve complex challenges. This can either be from a perspective of People practices and statutory regulations, or could be from supporting the implementation or development of IT solutions.
Responsibilities

Support the sourcing of and the building of a team of multinational individuals with relevant experience to deliver an HRIS solution across multiple countries within a cluster.
Liaise with senior stakeholders to ascertain business requirements alongside understanding business process requirements.
 Help design a systemic solution to best suit the Groups requirements.
Support the confirguration and Implemention of a HRIS solution across European countries.
 Maintain an understanding of legislative requirements for HCM, Time Capture and Pay for your specified cluster.
Implement systems and procedures to ensure BAU teams are trained and developed in system architecture and use.
Have a passion for providing quality, security and accuracy.
Deliver impeccable service to the wider People Team and wider business.
Design, build and test integrations between HR solution and other product workstreams.
Coordinate your team for the following activities: Compliance, SKU Testing, BAU Changes, Global Design templates and more

Requirements
 

Previous experience in HRIS architecture essential.
Ability to consider and evaluate solutions to problems under own initiative essential.
Previous experience in deploying HRIS solutions across multiple territories beneficial.
Previous experience in sourcing and/or developing multinational teams beneficial.
Ability to work on own initiative as well as part of a team.
Effective communication skills both written and oral.
Confident and courteous in dealing with internal and external stakeholders.
Prominent level of attention to detail with strong administrative and organisational skills and be able to prioritise your own and your teamâ€™s workload
Must be methodical and be able to work to strict deadlines.
 Have an awareness of GDPR and be able to act with absolute discretion and confidentiality.
Ambitious to learn with an enthusiastic approach.
Successful candidate must have valid passport and be able to travel internationally

At JD Group we offer a cooperation and mutual respect based environment, including a solid commitment with diversity and equal opportunities. All applicants will be considered as equal no matter their gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age nor disability status.
In our recruitment processes, we consider your knowledge and skills, as well as your passion to discover, grow and build new ideas.
What do we offer?

Percentage under objectives.
Flexible schedule.
Remote working.
Tax credit (health insurance, restaurant ticket, childcare ticket).
Employee discount.
Development and career plan in an international environment.
Training both in hard skills and soft skills.
Sport facilities in the company headquarters.
Employee Wellness Programs
Corporate Volunteer Programs within the working day.
